CONFIDENTIAL DISCLOSURE AGREEMENT

Date: date.

FIRST.- This document represents a non-binding document for a commercial agreement between ORGANIZATION NAME 1 ( Legal Name 1) and ORGANIZATION NAME 2 ( Legal Name 2), in order to implement a SERVICE NAME.

SECOND.- Parties undertake to maintain strict confidentiality of all information communicated between, on the occasion of activities or demonstrations of software or services performed between them. It will be considered "confidential" any information of business, commercial or technical nature, likely to be disclosed orally, in writing or by any other means or medium, tangible or intangible, currently known or that enables the state of the art in the future, exchanged by the parties as a result of this Agreement and all the Annexes and particularly those relating to customers, methodologies, business plans, know-how, business strategies, processes, products, or business applications.

THIRD.- The Parties undertake to adopt appropriate measures to ensure the confidentiality of such information, measures which not be lower than those applied by them to its own confidential information, assuming the following obligations:

  • Do not use the information provided by the other to the detriment of the economic and commercial interests of the issuer of such information.
  • Use confidential information only for their own use, which needs to be allocated under this Agreement.
  • Allow access to confidential information only to those individuals or legal entities that, in both cases providing its services to the Parties need the information for the development of tasks for which the use of this information is strictly necessary. The party receiving the information will force these people to subscribe or equivalent to keep this clause regarding confidentiality, ensuring the fulfillment of these obligations.
  • Communicate to the other party any information leakage that have or acquire knowledge produced by the violation of this confidentiality clause or infidelity of the people who have accessed confidential information on the understanding that such communication does not exempt the party in breach of this confidentiality commitment, responsibility, but if further breaches will lead to few responsibilities arising from this omission in particular.
  • Limit the use of confidential information exchanged between the Parties to the strictly necessary to achieve the purpose of this Agreement, assuming the party receiving confidential information responsibility for any use other than himself, by him or by individuals or law to which it has granted access to confidential information. This Agreement will not, in any case, the granting of permission or express or implied right to license the use of patents or copyrights owned by the party disclosing the information.
  • Not disclose or reveal information of the other party to any third party without prior written consent by the other party.

FOURTH.- Without prejudice to the obligations imposed by national legislation and/or assumed by the receiving party of the confidential information, the confidentiality obligations contained in this clause shall not apply to information in respect of which the receiving party can show:

  • That out of the public domain at the time it is disclosed.
  • That, after having been revealed, was published or otherwise pass into the public domain without breach of the confidentiality obligation by the party who received the information.
  • That at the time it is disclosed, the party received was already in possession of it by legal means or legally entitled to have access to it.
  • What had prior written consent of the other party to reveal the information.
  • What has been requested by the competent administrative or judicial authorities which must decide on full or partial aspects of it, in which case, the party that has to make the presentation must notify the other prior to that presentation takes place character.

FIFTH.- Previous commitments of confidentiality shall remain in force until two years after the termination or implementation of this Agreement, without this meaning that the information obtained or exchanged as a result of this Agreement, may be considered public or that any authorization for dissemination.

SIXTH.- Both Parties undertake not to use confidential information to which it has access to own or private purposes or any other purposes. In this regard, they undertake not to use such confidential information for the development of products or services that can be directly competitive with the products of the Parties.

SEVENTH- The breach of any of these clauses entitles both parties to take legal actions required and to demand compensation for damages caused. In witness as agreed, both parties have signed this agreement in duplicate and one effect, in the place and date indicated in the header.
